messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Stealth unschooling: was another request for help (more fun, maybe)
messages.msgSnippet: We re gonna have to go to YOUR dentist!
messages.messageBody:
We're gonna have to go to YOUR dentist!

:-) Diane

><< Unit studies is what I usually claim if pressed (being beat up all the
>time in school, I'm unprepared for conflict). We've been involved in a
>L-O-N-G unit study on trains, but if we make a visit to the Dr. office,
>we do a short unit study on the health care system. >>
>
>When I go to the dentist, I'm back on my unit study about Trains!! He's a
>train-fanatic, and photographs trains on trestles as a hobby. He has great
>photos he's taken, a bell off a steam engine in one of the examining rooms,
>all the calendars are train stuff...
>
>Sandra
>

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Stealth unschooling: was another request for help (more fun, maybe)
messages.msgSnippet: I did suggest exactly this reply to someone in KY who was concerned about getting turned in if she let her kids be seen out in public during school hours.
messages.messageBody:
I did suggest exactly this reply to someone in KY who was concerned
about getting "turned in" if she let her kids be seen out in public
during "school hours."

:-) Diane

>That's it. Next time we go do the food shopping and someone ask us why
>the boys aren't in school, I'll say :" They are home schooling, and
>today we are doing a unit study in home economics." :-)
>Friendship
>Lucie
>

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Stealth unschooling: was another request for help (more fun, maybe)
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/14/03 8:54:23 AM, lucie.caunter@sympatico.ca writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/14/03 8:54:23 AM, lucie.caunter@... writes:

<< That's it. Next time we go do the food shopping and someone ask us why
the boys aren't in school, I'll say :" They are home schooling, and
today we are doing a unit study in home economics." :-) >>

I hope you're wearing a denim jumper when you say that!
And the boys should have their hair freshly combed and be wearing slacks and
dress shirts.

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Stealth unschooling: was another request for help (more fun, maybe)
messages.msgSnippet: That s it.  Next time we go do the food shopping and someone ask us why the boys aren t in school, I ll say : They are home schooling, and today we are doing
messages.messageBody:
That's it. Next time we go do the food shopping and someone ask us why
the boys aren't in school, I'll say :" They are home schooling, and
today we are doing a unit study in home economics." :-)
Friendship
Lucie

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Stealth unschooling: was another request for help (more fun, maybe)
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/14/03 8:02:13 AM, cen46624@vol.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/14/03 8:02:13 AM, cen46624@... writes:

<< Unit studies is what I usually claim if pressed (being beat up all the
time in school, I'm unprepared for conflict). We've been involved in a
L-O-N-G unit study on trains, but if we make a visit to the Dr. office,
we do a short unit study on the health care system. >>

When I go to the dentist, I'm back on my unit study about Trains!! He's a
train-fanatic, and photographs trains on trestles as a hobby. He has great
photos he's taken, a bell off a steam engine in one of the examining rooms,
all the calendars are train stuff...

Sandra

messages.subject: [AlwaysLearning] Stealth unschooling: was another request for help (more fun, maybe)
messages.msgSnippet: ... Unit studies is what I usually claim if pressed (being beat up all the time in school, I m unprepared for conflict). We ve been involved in a L-O-N-G unit
messages.messageBody:
>
>
>I can hardly stand to have written a supportive paragraph about unit
>studies!!!!
>
Unit studies is what I usually claim if pressed (being beat up all the
time in school, I'm unprepared for conflict). We've been involved in a
L-O-N-G unit study on trains, but if we make a visit to the Dr. office,
we do a short unit study on the health care system.

:-) Diane
